article: Recently, one of my best friends, whom I"ve shared just about everything with since the first day of kindergarten, spent the week end with me. Since I moved to a new town several years ago, we"ve both always _ the few times a year when we can see each other. .Over the _ , we spent hours and hours, staying up late into the night, talking about the people she was _ around with. She started telling me stories about her new boyfriend, about how he experimented with _ and was into other _ behavior. I was blown away! She told me how she had been _ to her parents about where she was going and even sneaking out to see this guy because they didn"t want her _ him. No matter how hard I tried to tell her that she _ better, she didn"t believe me. Her self-respect seemed to have disappeared. I tried to _ her that she was ruining her future and heading for big trouble. I felt like I was getting _ . I just couldn"t believe that she really thought it was _ to hang with a bunch of losers, especially her boyfriend. By the time she left, I was really worried about her and _ by the experience. It had been so frustrating, I had come _ to telling her several times during the weekend that maybe we had just grown too far apart to _ our friendship - but I didn"t. I put the power of _ to the ultimate test. We"d been friends for far too long. The chance was that she _ me enough to know that I was trying to save her from hurting herself. I wanted to believe that our friendship could _ anything. a few days later, she called to say that she had thought long and hard about our _ , and then she told me that she had _ with her boyfriend. I just listened on the other end of the phone with tears of joy running down my face. It was one of the truly _ moments in my life. Never had I been so proud of a friend. 1.
